name: swiftlet
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a type of swift (= a small bird with curved pointed wings that can fly very fast), especially one that uses liquid from its mouth to make nests that are used in bird's nest soup (= a type of soup that is considered to be a very special food in China): Bird's nest soup is made from the nests of cave-dwelling birds called swiftlets. The limestone caves are home to a million swiftlets.
More examplesFewer examplesThe caves are famous for their edible, saliva-rich birds' nests.Swiftlets fly fearlessly and unerringly through the blackness.The echo-locating cave swiftlets of South-east Asia build their nests with saliva.
